thread.title: Norwegian foreign minister arrives in Dhaka to pay homage to Language Martyrs
thread.title_full: Norwegian foreign minister arrives in Dhaka to pay homage to Language Martyrs

title: Norwegian foreign minister arrives in Dhaka to pay homage to Language Martyrs
text:
Norwegian foreign minister arrives in Dhaka to pay homage to Language Martyrs Senior Correspondent, bdnews24.com Published: 2017-02-20 15:36:28.0 BdST Updated: 2017-02-20 15:36:28.0 BdST Borge Brende is the first ever foreign minister from a Nordic country to visit Bangladesh. Reuters file photo Norwegian Foreign Minister Borge Brende has arrived in Dhaka to pay homage to martyrs of the 1952 Language Movement. 
He is the first ever foreign minister from any Nordic country visiting Bangladesh, the Bangladesh foreign ministry said in a statement. 
Secretary (Bilateral & Consular) Kamrul Ahsan, Bangladesh Ambassador to Norway Md. Golam Sarwar and Director General of ministry's Europe Wing received him at the airport on Monday. 
During the visit, he will place floral wreath in the Central Shaheed Minar on Feb 21 to pay homage to the martyrs of the Language Movement. 
He is scheduled to leave Dhaka the same day, says the foreign ministry statement.
